item.source: My first model projects! (bandos + dragon and a7x mask) (nothing special)

item.title: My first model projects! (bandos + dragon and a7x mask) (nothing special)
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

Good start, but you should refrain from making recolours. As Elve Age said, try use primitives, i know it looks difficult but in the long run it helps you understand more about modeling. Start small aim high, start with something basic like a sword or something using primitives and eventually move on to making helmets and chest plates. That way, youâ€™ve time to learn how to manipulate and colour models to the way you want them.

Read full topic

item.title: My first model projects! (bandos + dragon and a7x mask) (nothing special)
item.dc:creator: @bms666 bms666
item.description:
@bms666 wrote:

i know its not too great but for the deathbat i just wanted to make something to test out putting it into the game. im a huge a7x fan so a deathbat is one of the first things that came to mind. i made it big on purpose

item.title: My first model projects! (bandos + dragon and a7x mask) (nothing special)
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

You should start working on manipulating primitives so you get the 3d look instead of it just being a flat trace. Keep us updated on your future models though.

Read full topic
